page.title: 12Food Production in St. Agnes
page.content: Farming, no longer on the scale it once was, is still mainly dairy farming. The milk quota, now an all- important factor, urges these farmers to add dairy related products such as cheese and yoghurt, rather than milk and cream alone. A few rear cattle for beef, but in the Mithian and Silverwell area, sheep are being raised on hilly ground. Potatoes, broccoli and other related vegetables are among the crops now grown. A long established Bakery in Churchtown produces fresh bread, rolls, cakes and fancies. The saffron cake is most popular, closely followed by the Cornish Gingerbread. Cornish Pasties are their speciality. Hundreds of scones are baked daily to meet the demand for Cream Teas. Lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers are grown in the many large greenhouses.
